Netherlands produced a stunning upset to knock South Africa out of the T20 World Cup with a 13-run victory at Adelaide Oval.
South Africa succumbed to a thirteen run defeat at the hands of the Netherlands on an Adelaide surface which was slow but certainly not unplayable.
South Africa lost the crucial make or break match at the Adelaide Oval to Netherlands by 13 runs.
Netherlands defeated South Africa by 13 runs, eliminating South Africa from the World Cup.
South Africa choked in front of a spirited Netherlands and crashed out of the T20 World Cup after suffering a 13-run defeat in their must-win match in Adelaide on Sunday.
Netherlands now qualify for the 2024 T20 World Cup.
South Africa's loss meant India are through to the semi-final.
Player of the Match Colin Ackermann scored an unbeaten 41 from 26 balls, helping Netherlands' late charge.
Colin Ackermann was named man-of-the-match for his unbeaten 41.
Brandon Glover took 3 wickets for 9 runs in two overs.
Brandon Glover dismissed David Miller and Wayne Parnell in the 16th over, with van der Merwe completing a sensational catch to dismiss Miller.
Roelof van der Merwe took a dramatic catch to dismiss David Miller.
Roelof van der Merwe's catch to eliminate South Africa was a significant moment.
Aiden Markram and Heinrich Klaasen's uninspiring batting reduced the Proteas to 113/6.
Brandon Glover's bowling performance was crucial, with no one having a better T20I bowling average for Netherlands.
South Africa eventually lost the match by 13 runs.
Brandon Glover returned with the figures of 3/9 in his two overs as he bagged the crucial wickets of Rilee Rossouw (25) and David Miller (17).
Brandon Glover dismissed David Miller for 17 and Wayne Parnell for nought in the same over.
Chasing 159, South Africa kept on losing timely wickets and at one stage were 39/2.
Colin Ackermann's late-hitting took Netherlands to 158/4 after put into bat.
Proteas had won the toss and bowled first. Barring Anrich Nortje, every other bowler went for runs.
Stephan Myburgh scored 37 runs for the Netherlands.
Fred Klaassen joined the party as South Africa continued to lose wickets in regular intervals. With asking run rate shooting, South Africa crumbled and were restricted to 145/8.
Stephan Myburgh scored 34 runs in the powerplay.
Last ball was hit for four by Anrich Nortje, but that was not enough.
Netherlands put a valiant showing with the bat amassing a decent total of 158 for 4 with ex-Proteas player Colin Ackerman scoring 41 of just 26 balls.
Colin Ackermann scored an unbeaten 41 off 26 balls, with 21 runs coming in the last two overs.
Netherlands scored 31 runs from the final two overs with contributions from Colin Ackermann and Scott Edwards.
Quinton de Kock and Temba Bavuma were out inside six overs with the score on 39.
Fred Klaassen took the wicket of Quinton de Kock.
Tom Cooper gave the innings the needed impetus with a quick-fire 35.
Quinton de Kock managed just six off eight balls and lost his wicket to Fred Klaassen.
South Africa's pursuit faltered after the loss of openers Quinton de Kock (13) and Temba Bavuma (20).
Klaassen had Aiden Markram caught by Stephan Myburgh, and Glover dismissed David Miller for 17 and Wayne Parnell for a duck.
Paul van Meekeren bowled Temba Bavuma for 20.
Brandon Glover bowled a slower legcutter to dismiss Rilee Rossouw in the tenth over.
David Miller and Heinrich Klaasen's dismissals were pivotal moments.
Rilee Rossouw was dismissed after a 19-ball 25.
Wayne Parnell was out for a duck, caught by Scott Edwards and bowled by Brandon Glover.
